alert.note: Alert for Boise Mountains; West Central Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 20 at 1:41PM MST until December 21 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Boise
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 5 AM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulation of 3 to 6 inches, locally 8 inches on higher slopes. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph will cause widespread blowing and drifting snow. * WHERE...West Central Mountains and Boise Mountains zones. * WHEN...From 5 PM this afternoon to 5 AM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The cold wind chills as low as 15 below zero could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Strongest wind gusts and most extensive blowing snow will occur between midnight and 5 AM MST.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
